Class ec.tables.PEHashtable 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----java.util.Dictionary
           |
           +----ec.tables.SimTable
                   |
                   +----ec.tables.PEHashtable
public class PEHashtable
extends SimTable
PEHashtable class. Maps keys to values. Any object can be used as a key and/or value.

To sucessfully store and retrieve objects from a hash table, the object used as the key must implement the hashCode() methods.

Unlike Hashtable, this uses pointer equality for keys and values.

PEHashtable()
Constructs a new, empty hashtable.
PEHashtable(int)
Constructs a new, empty hashtable with the specified initial capacity.
PEHashtable(int, float)

clone()
Creates a clone of the hashtable.

PEHashtable 
 public PEHashtable(int initialCapacity,
                    float loadFactor)
PEHashtable 
 public PEHashtable(int initialCapacity)
Constructs a new, empty hashtable with the specified initial capacity.

Parameters:
initialCapacity - the initial number of buckets
PEHashtable 
 public PEHashtable()
Constructs a new, empty hashtable. A default capacity and load factor is used. Note that the hashtable will automatically grow when it gets full.

clone 
 public synchronized Object clone()
Creates a clone of the hashtable. A shallow copy is made, the keys and elements themselves are NOT cloned. This is a relatively expensive operation.

Overrides:
clone in class SimTable
